*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Elias R Wightman, November 12, 1830. Surveying instructions.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="11-12-1830">12 Novr 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr E. R. Weightman*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Surveyor*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*I wrote a few days since to survey a *location_mentioned*quarter on the west side of Trespalacios*/location_mentioned* for *person_mentioned*John H. Scott*/person_mentioned*, and one for *person_mentioned*John T. Brush*/person_mentioned*. Since then*person_mentioned* C. Johnson*/person_mentioned* has applied for a *location_mentioned*quarter next below *person_mentioned*Scott */person_mentioned*on the same side of the creek*/location_mentioned*— he says that he wishes it run so as to have some front on the main *location_mentioned*Creek */location_mentioned*and then to run back of *person_mentioned*Scott */person_mentioned*across the *location_mentioned*Juanito*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*I cannot say whether it can be run in that way or not, for I do not know the situation— you can therefore use your own discretion, always taking care not to give too much front, nor to injure the *location_mentioned*adjoining tracts*/location_mentioned*, nor to have irregular *location_mentioned*vacancies*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*Make returns of these surveys as soon as you can as I wish to finish the titles before I leave for *location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*A*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
